main event: B-47 crew sighted a small object estimated at 35,000 feet, on a varying heading of about 270 degrees.
interesting points: The object did not appear to gain or lose altitude.
The appearance, bearings, and time of the sighting indicated the object was likely a celestial body, which was confirmed by checking with orbital tracks and the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory.
The observers were described as extremely reliable, including the aircraft commander, co-pilot, and assistant navigator.
The visibility was unlimited, with no cloud cover along the observation track.
Evaluation of the data concluded the object's characteristics and track coincided with the orbital track of Sputnik Beta in that area.
